TimerArray Class

Definition

Provides a control array of Timer controls

In this Article

[ECMA2Yaml.Models.ECMAAttribute]
[ECMA2Yaml.Models.ECMAAttribute]
public class TimerArray : Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray, System.ComponentModel.IExtenderProvider

Remarks

The TimerArray class provides an equivalent for the run-time functionality of a Visual Basic 6.0 Timer control array. It does not provide the design-time features of a Visual Basic 6.0 control array.

Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

Constructors

TimerArray()

Initializes a new instance of the TimerArray class.

public TimerArray ();
Attributes
ProvidePropertyAttribute ObsoleteAttribute

Remarks

When you instantiate a TimerArray, you must also call the SetIndex method to create the initial element in the array.

Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

TimerArray(IContainer)

Initializes a new instance of the TimerArray class, specifying its container.

public TimerArray (System.ComponentModel.IContainer Container);
Parameters
Container
IContainer

The IContainer where the control array will be hosted.

Attributes
ProvidePropertyAttribute ObsoleteAttribute

Remarks

When you instantiate a TimerArray, you must also call the SetIndex method to create the initial element in the array.

Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

Properties

Item(Int16)

Gets a specific element of a TimerArray by index. Read-only.

public System.Windows.Forms.Timer this[short Index] { get; }
Parameters
Index
Int16

A Short that specifies the position of an element of the control array.

Value
Timer

A Timer at the specified Index in the control array.

Attributes
ProvidePropertyAttribute ObsoleteAttribute

Remarks

The Item property is the default property for a control array. Therefore, the following lines of code are equivalent. 

MsgBox(CStr(TimerArray.Item(1).Text))  
MsgBox(CStr(TimerArray(1).Text))
Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

Methods

CanExtend(Object)

Gets a value that determines whether a control is a member of a TimerArray.

public bool CanExtend (object target);
Parameters
target
Object

A Timer control.

Returns
Boolean

true if target is a member of the control array; otherwise false.

Attributes
EditorBrowsableAttribute

Remarks

The CanExtend method can be used to determine whether a specific Timer control is the base element of the control array from which the other elements were cloned.

Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

GetControlInstanceType()

Overrides crosoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray.GetControlInstanceType*.

protected override Type GetControlInstanceType ();
Returns
Type

The TimerArray class is the base class for all control arrays that are used in applications upgraded from Visual Basic 6.0. Because this class is not typically used to create an instance of the class, this Protected method is usually not called directly but is instead called by a derived class.

Attributes
ProvidePropertyAttribute ObsoleteAttribute

Remarks

This method cannot be called from your application's code. Use the GetType method instead.

Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

GetIndex(Timer)

Gets the index of a Timer in a TimerArray.

public short GetIndex (System.Windows.Forms.Timer o);
Parameters
o
Timer

A Timer in the control array.

Returns
Int16

A Short that represents the index of the specified Timer.

Attributes
ProvidePropertyAttribute ObsoleteAttribute

Remarks

This method can be used to retrieve the index for the specified Timer.

Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

HookUpControlEvents(Object)

Overrides crosoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6.BaseControlArray.HookUpControlEvents*.

protected override void HookUpControlEvents (object o);
Parameters
o
Object

An Object.

Attributes
ProvidePropertyAttribute ObsoleteAttribute

Remarks

This method cannot be called from your application's code. Use AddHandler to hook up events for any controls that are added by using the Load method.

Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

ResetIndex(Timer)

The ResetIndex method is not supported in the TimerArray class.

public void ResetIndex (System.Windows.Forms.Timer o);
Parameters
o
Timer

A Control.

Attributes
EditorBrowsableAttribute

Remarks

This method is not supported, and calling it does not raise an exception.

Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

SetIndex(Timer, Int16)

Sets the index of the initial Timer in a TimerArray.

public void SetIndex (System.Windows.Forms.Timer o, short Index);
Parameters
o
Timer

A Timer in the control array.

Index
Int16

A Short that represents the index of the specified Timer.

Attributes
EditorBrowsableAttribute

Remarks

The SetIndex method should only be called when you are creating the initial element in the control array. To add subsequent elements, call the Load method and specify the Index.

Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

ShouldSerializeIndex(Timer)

Returns a value that indicates whether a Timer is a member of this TimerArray.

public bool ShouldSerializeIndex (System.Windows.Forms.Timer o);
Parameters
o
Timer

A Timer in the control array.

Returns
Boolean

true if o is a member of this control array; otherwise, false.

Attributes
EditorBrowsableAttribute

Remarks

If the specified Timer is a member of a different TimerArray, ShouldSerializeIndex returns false.

Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.

Events

Tick

Occurs when the specified timer interval has elapsed and the timer is enabled.

public event EventHandler Tick;
Attributes
ProvidePropertyAttribute ObsoleteAttribute

Remarks

For more information about how to handle events, see NIB: Consuming Events.

Note

Functions and objects in the Microsoft.VisualBasic.Compatibility.VB6 namespace are provided for use by the tools for upgrading from Visual Basic 6.0 to Visual Basic. In most cases, these functions and objects duplicate functionality that you can find in other namespaces in the .NET Framework. They are necessary only when the Visual Basic 6.0 code model differs significantly from the .NET Framework implementation.
